LanguageData.AA_Overgrown_DropPod.label: overgrown drop pod
LanguageData.AA_Overgrown_DropPod.description: This standard issue drop pod seems to have been modified to host a small self-contained ecosystem. As soon as it impacted, strange creeping vines and weird creatures emerged from it. It seems to be some kind of terraforming machine.\n\nYou can destroy it to avoid release of hostile lifeforms into this region, or wait until its work is done to see what happens.
LanguageData.AA_BlackHiveMound.label: black hive mound
LanguageData.AA_BlackHiveMound.description: A hive of giant insects. This mound was used by the Black Hive to tunnel to this territory, and is now inert. It will erode in a few days.
LanguageData.AA_SkySteelClumps.label: strange shiny mineral
LanguageData.AA_SkySteelClumps.description: This strange mineral is very hard and resilient. Perhaps you could find a way to extract useable materials from it.
LanguageData.AA_BlueGelBattery.label: blue gel battery
LanguageData.AA_BlueGelBattery.description: Can store more electricity than regular batteries thanks to the energetic make-up of blue gel. As a downside, they are highly flammable. Charged blue gel batteries explode when exposed to rain or fire.
LanguageData.AA_HexaGelBattery.label: hexagel battery
LanguageData.AA_HexaGelBattery.description: Can store more electricity than blue gel batteries. As a downside, they are highly flammable, and they will violently explode if destroyed. Charged hexagel batteries explode when exposed to rain or fire.
LanguageData.AA_HexagelCoreReactor.label: hexagel core reactor
LanguageData.AA_HexagelCoreReactor.description: Produces electricity from energy stored inside hexagel cores.
LanguageData.AA_MutantLeg.label: mutant leg
LanguageData.AA_MutantLeg.description: This leg seems to be covered in a slick secretion that constantly drips from every pore. Something seems... off about it, as if it wasn't a completely natural creation.
LanguageData.AA_MutantArm.label: mutant arm
LanguageData.AA_MutantArm.description: This arm twitches and bends in strange unnatural ways, as if it had a mind of its own. Something seems... off about it, as if it wasn't a completely natural creation.
LanguageData.AA_MutantEye.label: mutant eye
LanguageData.AA_MutantEye.description: This eye constantly blinks on its own, like a nervous tic, and a second set of vertical eyelids seems to be present behind the normal, human ones. Something seems... off about it, as if it wasn't a completely natural creation.
LanguageData.AA_TheOmniscientEye.label: the omniscient eye
LanguageData.AA_TheOmniscientEye.description: A bloodshot eye with a triangular pupil. This horrible mutant eye confers the gift of an improved psychic sight.
LanguageData.AA_TheRecalcitrantEye.label: the recalcitrant eye
LanguageData.AA_TheRecalcitrantEye.description: A weird mutant eye that is never fully open, being most of the time partially covered by a sickly looking eyelid. Strangely enough, it provides normal sight while at the same time protecting its host from psychic attacks.
LanguageData.AA_TheQuiescentEye.label: the quiescent eye
LanguageData.AA_TheQuiescentEye.description: An eye that never blinks, keeping itself moist by unknown means. It pervades its host with a sense of preternatural calmness.
LanguageData.AA_TheNumbingEye.label: the numbing eye
LanguageData.AA_TheNumbingEye.description: This strange mutant eye is covered by dense plates of bone instead of a normal fleshy eyelid, and seems to be almost impervious to pain.
LanguageData.AA_TheSpasmodicEye.label: the spasmodic eye
LanguageData.AA_TheSpasmodicEye.description: An eye that can't stop blinking uncontrollably. While extremely distracting and disconcerting, it allows its host to cast more psychic powers before exhaustion.
LanguageData.AA_TheMeretriciousEye.label: the meretricious eye
LanguageData.AA_TheMeretriciousEye.description: This gaudy looking eye seems to have a life of its own, trying to catch the attention of other people with carefully directed winks and furtive, sultry glances that beckon with a false allure. It allows its host to recover quicker from psychic exhaustion.
LanguageData.AA_TheHeuristicEye.label: the heuristic eye
LanguageData.AA_TheHeuristicEye.description: This eye analyzes its surroundings with carefully planned discipline, missing no details.
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneQueenEggFertilized.label: bumbledrone egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneQueenEggFertilized.descrip: Fertilized bumbledrone eggs. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into a bumbledrone.
LanguageData.AA_WildpodSpores.label: wildpod spore clump (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_WildpodSpores.description: Fertilized wildpod spores. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into a wildpod.
LanguageData.AA_AgaripodSpores.label: agaripod spore clump (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_AgaripodSpores.description: Fertilized agaripod spores. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into an agaripod.
LanguageData.AA_MycoidColossusSpores.label: mycoid colossus spore clump (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_MycoidColossusSpores.description: Fertilized mycoid colossus spores. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into a mycoid colossus.
LanguageData.AA_WildpawnSpores.label: wildpawn spore clump (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_WildpawnSpores.description: Fertilized wildpawn spores. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into a wildpawn.
LanguageData.AA_AgaripawnSpores.label: agaripawn spore clump (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_AgaripawnSpores.description: Fertilized agaripawn spores. I... I wouldn't eat this. Yuck. If all goes well, it should hatch into an agaripawn.
LanguageData.AA_IronhuskEggUnfertilized.label: ironhusk beetle egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_IronhuskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized ironhusk beetle egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_IronhuskEggFertilized.label: ironhusk beetle egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_IronhuskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized ironhusk beetle egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into an ironhusk beetle.
LanguageData.AA_MammothWormEggUnfertilized.label: mammoth worm egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_MammothWormEggUnfertilized.descriptio: Unfertilized mammoth worm egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a worm egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_MammothWormEggFertilized.label: mammoth worm egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_MammothWormEggFertilized.description: Fertilized mammoth worm egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a worm egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a mammoth worm.
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetleEggUnfertilized.desc: Unfertilized crepuscular beetle egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetleEggFertilized.label: crepuscular beetle egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetleEggFertilized.descri: Fertilized crepuscular beetle egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a crepuscular beetle.
LanguageData.AA_GreatDevourerEggUnfertilized.label: great devourer egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_GreatDevourerEggUnfertilized.descript: Unfertilized great devourer egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a worm egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_GreatDevourerEggFertilized.label: great devourer egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_GreatDevourerEggFertilized.descriptio: Fertilized great devourer egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a worm egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a great devourer.
LanguageData.AA_MegalouseEggUnfertilized.label: megalouse egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_MegalouseEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized megalouse egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a louse egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_MegalouseEggFertilized.label: megalouse egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_MegalouseEggFertilized.description: Fertilized megalouse egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a louse egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a megalouse.
LanguageData.AA_BedBugEggUnfertilized.label: bedbug egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_BedBugEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized bedbug egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_BedBugEggFertilized.label: bedbug egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_BedBugEggFertilized.description: Fertilized bedbug egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a beetle egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a bedbug.
LanguageData.AA_AnimaliskEggFertilized.label: animalisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_AnimaliskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized animalisk egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into an animalisk. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskEggUnfertilized.label: feralisk egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized feralisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskEggFertilized.label: feralisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized feralisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a feralisk.
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskSuperEggFertilized.label: charged feralisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskSuperEggFertilized.descriptio: Fertilized feralisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a feralisk. This egg seems to be developing at an alarmingly accelerated rate!
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskEggUnfertilized.label: dunealisk egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized dunealisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskEggFertilized.label: dunealisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized dunealisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a dunealisk.
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskSuperEggFertilized.label: charged dunealisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskSuperEggFertilized.descripti: Fertilized dunealisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a dunealisk. This egg seems to be developing at an alarmingly accelerated rate!
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskEggUnfertilized.label: blizzarisk egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized blizzarisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskEggFertilized.label: blizzarisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized blizzarisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a blizzarisk.
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskSuperEggFertilized.label: charged blizzarisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskSuperEggFertilized.descript: Fertilized blizzarisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a blizzarisk. This egg seems to be developing at an alarmingly accelerated rate!
LanguageData.AA_JungleliskEggUnfertilized.label: junglelisk egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_JungleliskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized junglelisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_JungleliskEggFertilized.label: junglelisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_JungleliskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized junglelisk egg. Non-edible. If all goes well, it should hatch into a junglelisk.
LanguageData.AA_CinderliskEggUnfertilized.label: cinderlisk egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_CinderliskEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized cinderlisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way...
LanguageData.AA_CinderliskEggFertilized.label: cinderlisk egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_CinderliskEggFertilized.description: Fertilized cinderlisk egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked. Actually, it's a spider egg, it is disgusting either way... If all goes well, it should hatch into a cinderlisk.
LanguageData.AA_EggNightlingFertilized.label: nightling egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggNightlingFertilized.description: Fertilized nightling egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby nightling. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggMeadowAveFertilized.label: meadow ave egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggMeadowAveFertilized.description: Fertilized meadow ave egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby meadow ave. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggDesertAveFertilized.label: desert ave egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggDesertAveFertilized.description: Fertilized desert ave egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby desert ave. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggNightAveFertilized.label: night ave egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggNightAveFertilized.description: Fertilized night ave egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby night ave. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggRoyalAveFertilized.label: royal ave egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggRoyalAveFertilized.description: Fertilized royal ave egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby royal ave. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggRoughPlatedMonitorFertilized.label: rough-plated monitor egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggRoughPlatedMonitorFertilized.descr: Fertilized rough-plated monitor egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a baby rough-plated monitor. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked. BE WARNED: Rough-plated Monitor eggs are violently unstable, and they explode when they hatch!
LanguageData.AA_AtispecEggFertilized.label: atispec egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_AtispecEggFertilized.description: Fertilized atispec egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a larval atispec. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_AngelMothEggFertilized.label: angel moth egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_AngelMothEggFertilized.description: Fertilized angel moth egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into an angel moth larva. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_DrainerEggFertilized.label: drainer egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_DrainerEggFertilized.description: Fertilized drainer egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a drainer larva. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_FireWaspEggFertilized.label: fire wasp egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_FireWaspEggFertilized.description: Fertilized fire wasp egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a fire wasp. Fire Wasp Eggs radiate an incredible amount of heat, and they can be dangerous if left unchecked, and extremely uncomfortable to eat.
LanguageData.AA_FireWaspEggUnfertilized.label: fire wasp egg (unfert.)
LanguageData.AA_FireWaspEggUnfertilized.description: Unfertilized fire wasp egg. Fire Wasp Eggs radiate an incredible amount of heat, and they can be dangerous if left unchecked, and extremely uncomfortable to eat.
LanguageData.AA_EggFlamingoPhoenixFertilized.label: flamingo phoenix egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggFlamingoPhoenixFertilized.descript: Fertilized flamingo phoenix egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a flamingo phoenix chick. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggCrescendoAnoleFertilized.label: crescendo anole egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggCrescendoAnoleFertilized.descripti: Fertilized crescendo anole egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a crescendo anole. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggPedigreedRaptorFertilized.label: pedigreed raptor egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggPedigreedRaptorFertilized.descript: Fertilized pedigreed raptor egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a pedigreed raptor. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterflyEggFertilized.label: empress butterfly egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterflyEggFertilized.descrip: Fertilized empress butterfly egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into an empress butterfly larva. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggGiantCrownedSilkieUnfertilized.des: An unfertilized giant crowned silkie egg. It can be eaten raw, but it's much, much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_EggGiantCrownedSilkieFertilized.label: giant crowned silkie egg (fert.)
LanguageData.AA_EggGiantCrownedSilkieFertilized.descr: A fertilized giant crowned silkie egg. If all goes well, it should hatch into a giant crowned silkie. It can be eaten raw, but it's much better cooked.
LanguageData.AA_AerofleetMeat.label: aerofleet meat
LanguageData.AA_AerofleetMeat.description: Raw meat from an aerofleet.\n\nChewy, gelatinous and insipid. Similar in texture to a jellyfish.
LanguageData.AA_OcularJellyMeat.label: ocular jelly meat
LanguageData.AA_OcularJellyMeat.description: Raw meat from an ocular jelly.\n\nChewy, gelatinous and insipid. Similar in texture to a jellyfish.
LanguageData.AB_RawRedSlime.label: raw red slime
LanguageData.AB_RawRedSlime.description: Raw red slime. This thing is edible. Barely.
LanguageData.AA_CactusMeat.label: plant meat
LanguageData.AA_CactusMeat.description: This strange meat is part vegetable, part animal. Confusing, to say the least.
LanguageData.AA_BlackInsectJelly.label: black hive insect jelly
LanguageData.AA_BlackInsectJelly.description: Jelly stored and used as food by oversized insects. It is smooth, rich, and fulfills the recreation need of those who consume it. Because of its unique biological properties, it can nourish almost any creature and never rots. This particular insect jelly is pitch black in colour and seems to be more nutritive than usual.
LanguageData.AA_RandomStones.label: random stone
LanguageData.AA_RandomStones.description: This should never appear ingame. If it does, it's a bug
LanguageData.AA_RandomBricks.label: random bricks
LanguageData.AA_RandomBricks.description: This should never appear ingame. If it does, it's a bug
LanguageData.AA_CactipineQuill.label: medicinal cactipine quill
LanguageData.AA_CactipineQuill.description: These quills are coated with a powerful anesthetic, and can be used as an alternative to herbal medicines. Not as powerful as industrial medicine, but useful in an emergency situation.
LanguageData.AA_BlueMilk.label: blue milk
LanguageData.AA_BlueMilk.description: "Milk" from a frostbound behemoth. Very nutritive but the colour is more than a little unsettling.
LanguageData.AA_GowMilk.label: gow milk
LanguageData.AA_GowMilk.description: Milk from a spined gow. Very nutritive but the reddish colour is a little unsettling.
LanguageData.AA_DisgustingMealNutrientPaste.label: disgusting nutrient paste meal
LanguageData.AA_DisgustingMealNutrientPaste.descripti: A synthetic mixture of protein, carbohydrates, and vitamins, amino acids and minerals. Everything the body needs, and absolutely disgusting. This paste is EVEN more disgusting than the paste produced by a nutrient paste dispenser, and people will just outright hate eating it. It was cheap, though!\n\nThis slurry is edible for carnivore and omnivore animals, but barely, and completely indigestible for herbivores.
LanguageData.AA_GallatrossHorn.label: gallatross horn
LanguageData.AA_GallatrossHorn.description: A Gallatross' horn. This rock-hard horn is very valuable, and given the dangers inherent in hunting a Gallatross, a scarce commodity.
LanguageData.AA_GallatrossHorn.tools.0.label: point
LanguageData.AA_GallatrossHorn.tools.1.label: base
LanguageData.GU_RedWood.label: red wood
LanguageData.GU_RedWood.description: This red tinged wood is oddly strong, and a sweet scent emanates from it. Less flammable than terrestrial wood, but quite ugly.
LanguageData.GU_RedWood.tools.0.label: red wood log
LanguageData.AA_SkySteel.label: sky steel
LanguageData.AA_SkySteel.description: A weird iron based compound found in a fallen asteroid. Stronger than normal steel, but a terrible insulator.
LanguageData.AA_UraniumCrystals.label: unrefined uranium crystals
LanguageData.AA_UraniumCrystals.description: This crystal can be refined in a chemfuel refinery into uranium.
LanguageData.AA_BlueGel.label: blue gel
LanguageData.AA_BlueGel.description: A syrupy residue extracted from Aerofleets which can be refined into an energy-dense compound. It can be used to build powerful batteries and generators with the appropriate research (Biofuel refining to process it further, and Batteries).
LanguageData.AA_Hexagel.label: hexagel
LanguageData.AA_Hexagel.description: A crystallized and condensed variety of blue gel. Hexagel is capable of storing much more energy than its non-refined cousin, but it also seems to be quite unstable. Hexagel can be used to build powerful batteries and generators, with the appropiate research (Batteries and Advanced Fabrication).
LanguageData.AA_HexagelCore.label: hexagel core
LanguageData.AA_HexagelCore.description: A hexagonal shaped energy core composed of -in itself highly unstable- hydrogen-rich blue gel stabilized within a uranium shell.
LanguageData.AA_AgariluxRawFungus.label: agarilux raw fungus
LanguageData.AA_AgariluxRawFungus.description: Raw Agarilux from a living Agaripod, they are very nice to eat, even when raw.
LanguageData.AA_RottingMoundItem.label: fermented rotting mound
LanguageData.AA_RottingMoundItem.description: This is a clump of rotting organic matter. It has begun fermenting and reeks of rot and alcohol.
LanguageData.AA_HugeAnimaPearl.label: huge anima pearl
LanguageData.AA_HugeAnimaPearl.description: This huge anima pearl seems to be bursting with barely contained living energy. It can be planted and an anima tree will grow from it.
LanguageData.AA_NightMilk.label: night milk
LanguageData.AA_NightMilk.description: Very nutritive but the colour is more than a little unsettling.
LanguageData.AA_BlackTruffles.label: black truffles
LanguageData.AA_BlackTruffles.description: Raw black truffles. A delicious and valuable variety of fungus.
LanguageData.AA_Leather_Behemoth.label: behemoth scales
LanguageData.AA_Leather_Behemoth.description: Hard overlapping scales of draconic chitin. It is exceptionally durable in combat, but provides little protection from weather.
LanguageData.AA_Leather_Aerofleet.label: aerofleet fur
LanguageData.AA_Leather_Aerofleet.description: A fuzzy, soft layer of pliable material. Not as tough as other types of leather, but a decent insulator.
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion_Leather.label: arctic lion fur
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion_Leather.description: White thick leather covered in a long, rugged mat of fur. Harvested from an arctic lion. This thick skin insulates and protects really well.
LanguageData.AA_SandLion_Leather.label: sand lion fur
LanguageData.AA_SandLion_Leather.description: Cream coloured thick leather covered in a long, rugged mat of fur. Harvested from a sand lion. This thick skin insulates from heat and protects really well.
LanguageData.Leather_Chitin.label: insect chitin
LanguageData.Leather_Chitin.description: Hard overlapping scales of insectoid chitin. It is exceptionally durable in combat, but provides little protection from weather.
LanguageData.Leather_IronChitin.label: iron chitin
LanguageData.Leather_IronChitin.description: Super hard overlapping scales of insectoid chitin. It seems to be reinforced with some kind of iron lattice.
LanguageData.Leather_RaptorPlates.label: hardened chitin
LanguageData.Leather_RaptorPlates.description: Overlapping plates of hardened chitin. Really durable in combat, but provides little protection from weather.
LanguageData.Leather_Cactus.label: sentient plant skin
LanguageData.Leather_Cactus.description: This strange material seems to be part animal hide, part living plant tissue. It traps cold water inside, acting as an incredibly good thermal insulator for hot climates.
LanguageData.Leather_BlackChitin.label: black insect chitin
LanguageData.Leather_BlackChitin.description: Hard overlapping scales of insectoid chitin. It is exceptionally durable in combat, but provides little protection from weather.
LanguageData.Leather_Gallatross.label: gallatross leather
LanguageData.Leather_Gallatross.description: This furry hide is of exceptional quality. Probably one of the best possible leathers on the Rim.
LanguageData.Leather_Night.label: night leather
LanguageData.Leather_Night.description: Thick leather, darker than the darkest night. This thick skin insulates and protects very well.
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolTemperate.label: chameleon yak wool, temperate
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolTemperate.description: A coarse brown wool with long fibers. Quite strong and warm.
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolWinter.label: chameleon yak wool, winter
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolWinter.description: A coarse white wool with long fibers. Quite strong and specifically adapted to extremely cold climates.
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolJungle.label: chameleon yak wool, jungle
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolJungle.description: A coarse green wool with long fibers intertwined with a keratin like substance. Super strong, but not very good for insulation.
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolDesert.label: chameleon yak wool, desert
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYakWoolDesert.description: A coarse tan wool with long fibers and a pseudo-crystalline lattice of organic support structures underneath. Quite strong, and very good at keeping the desert heat out.
LanguageData.AA_CinderSilk.label: cindersilk
LanguageData.AA_CinderSilk.description: This silk is as strong as synthread, but it is also an excellent thermal insulator. It is completely non-flammable.
LanguageData.AA_MothSilk.label: moth silk
LanguageData.AA_MothSilk.description: A very tough silk extracted from Angel moths. Very poor insulator.
LanguageData.AA_GiantCrownedSilkieSilk.label: giant crowned silkie silk
LanguageData.AA_GiantCrownedSilkieSilk.description: A soft silk produced by the giant crowned silkie. Once woven it has a very similar texture to sheep wool, but softer. Considered a luxury item.
LanguageData.AA_GreyCoatedMouflonWool.label: grey-coated mouflon wool
LanguageData.AA_GreyCoatedMouflonWool.description: Grey-coated mouflon wool. It provides good insulation.
LanguageData.AA_NightWool.label: night wool
LanguageData.AA_NightWool.description: This dark hued wool is soft, light and provides very good insulation. Stronger than other similar wools.
LanguageData.AA_SiegeTurret.label: siege turret
LanguageData.AA_SiegeTurret.description: A huge turret that fires explosive warheads.

LanguageData.AA_Plant_PollenTrumpet.label: pollen trumpet
LanguageData.AA_Plant_PollenTrumpet.description: A cultivated flower with a tubular structure and bright orange flowers when mature. Pollen trumpets are the favourite food source of empress butterflies.
LanguageData.AA_Heat_Ambrosia.label: heat resistant ambrosia bush
LanguageData.AA_Heat_Ambrosia.description:
A rare wild bush which yields the ambrosia fruit. Ambrosia fruit is delicious and produces a drug-like mood boost. Ambrosia cannot be farmed, which makes wild ambrosia groves very valuable.

Its rarity, beauty, and desirability are why ambrosia was named after the food of the ancient Greek gods.

This particular plant has been genetically modified to withstand low terrain fertility.
LanguageData.AA_RottingMound.label: fermented rotting mound
LanguageData.AA_RottingMound.description: This is a clump of rotting organic matter. It has begun fermenting and reeks of rot and alcohol.
LanguageData.AA_AlienGrass.label: alien grass
LanguageData.AA_AlienGrass.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based, and it seems to be decaying quickly from exposure to a terrestrial environment.
LanguageData.AA_RedLeaves.label: alien plant
LanguageData.AA_RedLeaves.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based, and it seems to be decaying quickly from exposure to a terrestrial environment.
LanguageData.AA_RedPlantsTall.label: alien plant
LanguageData.AA_RedPlantsTall.description: This grass is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based, and it seems to be decaying quickly from exposure to a terrestrial environment.
LanguageData.AA_AlienTree.label: ocular tree
LanguageData.AA_AlienTree.description: This tree is completely alien, probably not even 100% carbon based, and it seems to be struggling to grow from exposure to a terrestrial environment. Strange fruits resembling eyeballs hang from the tree, but they are probably not edible. Its wood releases a powerful, sweet scent. Perhaps it can be somehow useful?
LanguageData.AA_AcanthamoebaGiganteaSmall.label: acanthamoeba gigantea, small
LanguageData.AA_AcanthamoebaGiganteaSmall.description:
Literally the "giant spiked amoeba", this strange creature is a huge unicellular organism genetically modified to serve as a biological cleaning machine. Acanthamoebas will happily feed on most types of non-metallic trash, engorging themselves in the process.

After a certain amount of feedings, Acanthamoebas will increase in size and, after reaching a threshold, they will split into two different individuals. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).

After a certain amount of feedings, Acanthamoebas will increase in size and, after reaching a threshold, they will split into two different individuals. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized.

LanguageData.AA_AcanthamoebaGiganteaHuge.description:
Literally the "giant spiked amoeba", this strange creature is a huge unicellular organism genetically modified to serve as a biological cleaning machine. Acanthamoebas will happily feed on most types of non-metallic trash, engorging themselves in the process.

After a certain amount of feedings, Acanthamoebas will increase in size and, after reaching a threshold, they will split into two different individuals. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Aerofleet.label: aerofleet
LanguageData.AA_Aerofleet.description:
A small, floating gelatinous creature. Propelled by the hydrogen it collects from water and various plant matter, these squishy creatures wander the lands, aimlessly bouncing off objects in their path. One of the few rare creatures around here that strangely isn’t out for human blood. Well, isn’t that nice?

Aerofleets are genderless, and reproduce by strobilation, a form of asexual reproduction. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized. As a floating creature, Aerofleets ignore terrain movement costs.

Aerofleets slowly produce a thick, gelatinous substance known as Blue Gel. This syrupy residue can be collected and refined into an energy-dense compound, and potentially used to build powerful batteries and generators, with the appropriate research (Biofuel refining, Batteries and Advanced Fabrication).

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Aerofleet.tools.1.label: tentacles
LanguageData.AA_ColossalAerofleet.label: colossal aerofleet
LanguageData.AA_ColossalAerofleet.description:
A huge, floating gelatinous creature. Propelled by the hydrogen it collects from water and various plant matter, these squishy creatures wander the lands, aimlessly bouncing off objects in their path. One of the few rare creatures around here that strangely isn’t out for human blood. Well, isn’t that nice?

This Aerofleet has somehow grown to extreme size. A small number of younger Aerofleets seem to be attracted to it and follow it everywhere.

Colossal Aerofleets produce a thick, gelatinous substance known as Blue Gel. This syrupy residue can be collected and refined into an energy-dense compound, and potentially used to build powerful batteries and generators with the appropriate research (Biofuel refining, Batteries and Advanced Fabrication).

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_ColossalAerofleet.tools.1.label: tentacles
LanguageData.AA_Agaripawn.label: agaripawn
LanguageData.AA_Agaripawn.description: The Agaripawn is a subspecies of the Wildpawn that has grown in the secluded environment of a Mycotic Jungle. Its body is covered by Agarilux mushrooms that seem to be in a state of symbiosis. Agaripawns are less resistant to gunfire than Agaripods, but retain the weakness to fire of their bigger brethren. Agaripawns reproduce asexually by releasing clumps of spores every few weeks, so their children are completely wild and independent of them, with no concept of parenthood. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized.\n\nAlthough risky, the Agaripawn can be hunted or farmed for small amounts of edible raw agarilux, which can be eaten raw and lasts a bit more than regular fungus.
LanguageData.AA_Agaripawn.tools.0.label: left paw
LanguageData.AA_Agaripawn.tools.1.label: right paw
LanguageData.AA_Agaripawn.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Agaripod.label: agaripod
LanguageData.AA_Agaripod.description: The Agaripod is a subspecies of the Wildpod that has grown in the secluded environment of a Mycotic Jungle. Its body is covered by Agarilux mushrooms that seem to be in a state of symbiosis. The Agaripod is almost impervious to gunfire, with bullets simply being absorbed into its mass without doing much damage, but very weak to fire. Interestingly, it reproduces asexually by releasing clumps of spores every few weeks, so its children are completely wild and independent of it, with no concept of parenthood. Note that asexual creatures can't be sterilized.\n\nAlthough risky, the Agaripod can be hunted or farmed for decent amounts of edible raw agarilux, which can be eaten raw and lasts a bit more than regular fungus.
LanguageData.AA_Agaripod.tools.0.label: left paw
LanguageData.AA_Agaripod.tools.1.label: right paw
LanguageData.AA_Agaripod.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_AngelMothLarva.label: angel moth larva
LanguageData.AA_AngelMothLarva.description:
Angel moths are beautiful lepidopterans that undergo metamorphosis, similar to other more mundane moths. Angel moths are yet another example of a genetically engineered project of waste disposal being abandoned, and its subjects being released into the wild.

The larvae are quite timid and harmless, and they are content with munching on sparse vegetation. The adult form of the moth, however, is voracious, and it will mainly consume its favourite food: clothing –in particular wool clothes, but many other natural fibres–. If no clothes are present they'll grudgingly devour grass. Although they can be used to get rid of unwanted clothing, it is hard to make them discriminate, as they are quite unruly creatures.

Adult specimens produce a moth silk that can be harvested to use as a textile, though care must be taken to keep it out of other moths' reach, since they'll happily consume it too.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_AngelMothLarva.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_AngelMoth.label: angel moth
LanguageData.AA_AngelMoth.description:
Angel moths are beautiful lepidopterans that undergo metamorphosis, similar to other more mundane moths. Angel moths are yet another example of a genetically engineered project of waste disposal being abandoned, and its subjects being released into the wild.

The larvae are quite timid and harmless, and they are content with munching on sparse vegetation. The adult form of the moth, however, is voracious, and it will mainly consume its favourite food: clothing –in particular wool clothes, but many other natural fibres–. If no clothes are present they'll grudgingly devour grass. Although they can be used to get rid of unwanted clothing, it is hard to make them discriminate, as they are quite unruly creatures.

Adult specimens produce a moth silk that can be harvested to use as a textile, though care must be taken to keep it out of other moths' reach, since they'll happily consume it too.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_AnimaColossus.label: anima colossus
LanguageData.AA_AnimaColossus.description:
The Anima Colossus is a variant of the Overgrown colossus native to the legendary anima forests.

It seems to be reptilian in nature, with cold blood, a slow metabolism, and a very weird body plan: it has six legs, two intertwined spines and six eyes. It has a symbiotic relationship with anima vegetation, with several Anima Trees and Mystic Cap mushrooms growing on its back. These plants seem to provide sustenance in a symbiotic relationship with the colossus.

When tamed, the Anima Colossus can be periodically "trimmed" to obtain wood. It will also very rarely produce a huge, hardened anima pearl, which can be planted to grow a new Anima Tree (this interaction requires Royalty).

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_AnimaColossus.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.label: animalisk
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.description:
The Animalisk is a psionically gifted variation of the Feralisk, most likely artificially mutated, adapted to living in the very rare Anima forests. Animalisks are the only herbivorous species of Lisks, so they aren't as dangerous to colonies as the rest of their kin. They are however very fond of Anima grass and Anima trees, and as such can be quite obnoxious if they are not quickly controlled.

Animalisks defend themselves by throwing spider webs at their harassers. These huge webs stun anyone they touch, allowing the Animalisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Animalisk.verbs.0.label: web
LanguageData.AA_AnimusVox.label: animus vox
LanguageData.AA_AnimusVox.description:
The Animus Vox is a small canine with latent psionic abilities. Like all canines, it is quite intelligent for an animal, but not intelligent enough to properly use psionics. It will however quickly bond with human beings and reach with its mind to make happy everyone that treats it well.

Animus Voxes can often be seen on the Rim as pets, though some wander the wilderness, looking for someone to bond to.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_AnimusVox.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_AnimusVox.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_AnimusVox.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion.label: arctic lion
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion.description:
These large descendants of the now almost extinct lion were specifically engineered as ambush units by the navy for extreme low temp environments. Its fur is prized throughout the black market for its unique light reflecting ability and its tough leather provides surprisingly high thermal insulation.

Even though its danger and capabilities are common knowledge; many still attempt to bag its head. Those who try usually end up losing theirs.

Concept and art by A_Friend (aka SentientLine), the original Alpha Animals artist.
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_ArcticLion.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_LarvalAtispec.label: larval atispec
LanguageData.AA_LarvalAtispec.description:
Atispecs are strange semi-insectoid creatures that undergo a radical metamorphosis, similar to old terran butterflies. In their larval phase, atispecs are basically harmless: a medium-sized grub that feeds on plants and usually ends up as some predator's meal. Tens of thousands of atispec larvae hatch every season, and less than a dozen make it to their adult form.

An adult Atispec, however, is an entirely different matter: huge, carnivorous and venomous. Adult Atispecs are flying predators with a voracious appetite, and quite intelligent. There have been attempts to domesticate the adult specimens, but it has been found that it is not quite cost-effective to grow them during their 2-year-long vulnerable phase as larvae.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_LarvalAtispec.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Atispec.label: atispec

Atispecs are strange semi-insectoid creatures that undergo a radical metamorphosis, similar to old terran butterflies. In their larval phase, atispecs are basically harmless: a medium-sized grub that feeds on plants and usually ends up as some predator's meal. Tens of thousands of atispec larvae hatch every season, and less than a dozen make it to their adult form.

An adult Atispec, however, is an entirely different matter: huge, carnivorous and venomous. Adult Atispecs are flying predators with a voracious appetite, and quite intelligent. Based on a design by Brent Hollowell: https://www.artstation.com/brenthollowell

LanguageData.AA_Atispec.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_AuroraSylph.label: Aurora sylph
LanguageData.AA_AuroraSylph.description:
A wispy-looking creature that is the only known example of plasma-based life in the Rim: the Aurora Sylph is of artificial origins, and its biology is so strange that only the most advanced glitterworld technology could have been responsible for its creation. It is believed that the sylphs were created as a lifeform capable of surviving in the atmosphere of Red Dwarf stars, for utterly inscrutable purposes. They don't seem to be affected by gravity much, so they can also be found stranded in the gravity well of a planet.

Sylphs are immune to temperature extremes, though very fragile and easy to damage. They don't need to eat, as they will replenish their energy simply by absorbing light. If they are content, they will periodically influence the magnetic fields of a planet, and cause beautiful auroras, hence their name.

Based on concept art by Maugryph, https://maugryph.com.

Art by AetherealVanguard (check Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/aethereaii/).
LanguageData.AA_Barbslinger.label: barbslinger
LanguageData.AA_Barbslinger.description: A large genetically-modified scorpion. No one really knows where they came from, but judging by its ability to rip apart living things within reach and shish kebab those outside of it, it’s a monster made for war.\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).

LanguageData.AA_BedBug.label: bedbug
LanguageData.AA_BedBug.description: These oversized insects are considered a pest and a nuisance in every world they manage to infest. While not particularly dangerous or powerful on their own, their bite carries a powerful toxin that paralyzes its prey, so one small bite is enough to down prey much larger than themselves. Thankfully, humans are way too large for them, unless they are somehow maddened beyond all reason... Hunters should be wary not to tackle a bedbug on their own!\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BedBug.tools.0.label: mandibles
LanguageData.AA_BedBug.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.label: Behemoth
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.description: A Forsaken creature, which is believed to reside in the outer star belts. Legends speak of incredibly intelligent and fierce dragons, ruling over whole planets with their devastating fire breaths and incomprehensible power. The thunder is their voice and announces their coming. They were once hundreds, and are now but a few. On the last days of the Forsaken, they will rise again and darken the skies, when the day of judgement comes.\n\nSpecial abilities: Behemoths were used as powerful beasts of burden by the Forsakens, and they can defend themselves quite well. Their flame attacks are quite dangerous. They can regenerate their wounds quite fast.
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.tools.0.label: left dragonclaw
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.tools.1.label: right dragonclaw
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.tools.2.label: razorfangs
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.tools.3.label: devour
LanguageData.AA_Behemoth.verbs.0.label: flame breath
LanguageData.AA_BlackScarab.label: black scarab
LanguageData.AA_BlackScarab.description: This large, genetically-engineered beetle is part of the Black Hive, an artificial ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight mechanoid invasions. The Black Hive was designed to be much more aggressive than usual, and several new species were created and added to the Hive to increase its lethality. Black scarabs are little more than cannon fodder, released ahead of the main insectoid horde to draw enemy fire. A eusocial creature, it cannot reproduce individually.\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BlackScarab.tools.0.label: mandibles
LanguageData.AA_BlackScarab.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpelopede.label: black spelopede
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpelopede.description: A medium-sized bioengineered insectoid the size of a sheep that is part of the Black Hive, an artificial ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight mechanoid invasions. The Black Hive was designed to be much more aggressive than usual, and several new species were created and added to the Hive to increase its lethality. The spelopede is the middle caste of a hive, taking care of most work tasks as well as fighting with its digging claws. It's dangerous in combat, but slow on open ground.\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpelopede.tools.0.label: head claw
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpelopede.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpelopede.verbs.0.label: venomous spit
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpider.label: blackspider
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpider.description: Not actually a spider, the blackspider is a genetically-engineered giant insectoid the size of a bear. This creature is part of the Black Hive, an artificial ecosystem of insectoids designed to fight mechanoid invasions. The Black Hive was designed to be much more aggressive than usual, and several new species were created and added to the Hive to increase its lethality. Designed for heavy work and combat, its thick chitinous armor makes it hard to kill, while its long ripper-blades make it deadly at close quarters.\n\nArt by Gon (check more at https://twitter.com/GON_again).
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpider.tools.0.label: head claw
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpider.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_BlackSpider.verbs.0.label: venomous spit
LanguageData.AA_Blizzarisk.label: blizzarisk
LanguageData.AA_Blizzarisk.description:
Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for hyperweave-webs production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire. The Blizzarisk is a mutant variation of the Feralisk that has adapted to extremely cold climates.

Blizzarisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs both stun and freeze anyone they touch, allowing the Blizzarisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Blizzarisk.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_Blizzarisk.tools.1.label: right first leg

LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskClutchMother.label: blizzarisk clutch mother
LanguageData.AA_BlizzariskClutchMother.description:
Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for hyperweave-webs production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire. The Blizzarisk is a mutant variation of the Feralisk that has adapted to extremely cold climates

Blizzarisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs both stun and freeze anyone they touch, allowing the Blizzarisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

This Blizzarisk seems to be of much larger size than usual, and is carrying a clutch of eggs on its back. This sounds like a recipe for disaster if not dealt with quickly.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).

LanguageData.AA_BloodShrimp.label: blood shrimp
LanguageData.AA_BloodShrimp.description:
A smaller relative of the Raptor Shrimp, the Blood Shrimp lacks the impressive regenerative abilities of its larger counterpart. Blood Shrimp compensate this disadvantage by being faster and more agile.

Blood Shrimps are vampiric, feeding on blood and being able to regenerate their wounds when drinking the blood of live animals.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BloodShrimp.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_BloodShrimp.tools.2.label: left blade
LanguageData.AA_BloodShrimp.tools.3.label: right blade
LanguageData.AA_Bobeene.label: bobeene
LanguageData.AA_Bobeene.description:
The cheekily named bobeene is a huge insect created specifically to feed on the gigantic flowers of an utopìan Idyllic Meadow. Although based on an obviously insectoid geneline, they have been carefully designed to produce meat that is virtually indistinguishable from beef.

Bobeenes are peaceful, unintelligent beasts that are content with buzzing around the meadows, and make for excellent dairy cattle and pack animals. They hover over terrain, thus ignoring movement costs.

Based on concept art by Talenshi: https://www.deviantart.com/talenshi/art/Cow-Bee-588372740
LanguageData.AA_Bobeene.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Bobeene.tools.2.label: left hoof
LanguageData.AA_Bobeene.tools.3.label: right hoof
LanguageData.AA_BoulderMit.label: bouldermit
LanguageData.AA_BoulderMit.description:
A large genetically-engineered crab which uses a boulder for a shell. It is alternatively known as the Atlas Crab throughout various colonized planets. These massive creatures sport incredible strength and are commonly seen carrying giant boulders that would normally crush living things and machinery alike. Legends tell of one such creature that has grown so large and so powerful that it had entire mountains for a home.

Despite first impressions, it is quite peaceful, preferring to ignore any form of assault it may receive. Its predators are more likely to die of old age than to take down such an armored creature.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BoulderMit.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_SummitCrab.label: summit crab
LanguageData.AA_SummitCrab.description: Legends tell of a great bouldermit that had grown so large and so powerful that it had entire mountains for a home.\n\nThis one probably isn't the sole originator of such tales, but it is a fine example of a creature whose path you certainly don't want to cross.
LanguageData.AA_SummitCrab.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Bumbledrone.label: bumbledrone
LanguageData.AA_Bumbledrone.description: The Bumbledrone is a mutant wasp-like creature, probably the result of ancient genetic engineering long ago released into the wild. On its own, a Bumbledrone isn't very powerful, more a nuisance than a threat, but if threatened in big numbers their stingers carry a very powerful toxin that could down even the biggest foe. "Luckily", since they are not carnivorous, they use this as a deterrent, rather than as a hunting method. As a floating creature, Bumbledrones ignore terrain movement costs.\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Bumbledrone.tools.1.label: claws
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneHierophant.label: bumbledrone hierophant
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneHierophant.description: The Bumbledrone is a mutant wasp-like creature, probably the result of ancient genetic engineering long ago released into the wild. On its own, a Bumbledrone isn't very powerful, more a nuisance than a threat, but if threatened in big numbers their stingers carry a very powerful toxin that could down even the biggest foe. "Luckily", since they are not carnivorous, they use this as a deterrent, rather than as a hunting method. As a floating creature, Bumbledrones ignore terrain movement costs.\n\nThis bigger than average bumbledrone is called a "hierophant". Each bumbledrone colony has a few drones that develop further into powerful killing machines. Aside from their nasty venom, hierophants are armed with a pair of vicious claws that take quick care of any enemies of the colony.
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneHierophant.tools.1.label: claws
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneQueen.label: bumbledrone queen
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneQueen.description:
The Bumbledrone is a mutant wasp-like creature, probably the result of ancient genetic engineering long ago released into the wild. On its own, a Bumbledrone isn't very powerful, more a nuisance than a threat, but if threatened in big numbers their stingers carry a very powerful toxin that could down even the biggest foe. "Luckily", since they are not carnivorous, they use this as a deterrent, rather than as a hunting method.

This particular bumbledrone seems to be a "queen", so called because it seems to deposit eggs from which other bumbledrones may hatch. It tends to do this specially once it has settled into an environment it considers safe, so it might be a really useful asset to tame it.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_BumbledroneQueen.tools.1.label: claws
LanguageData.AA_Cactipine.label: cactipine
LanguageData.AA_Cactipine.description: In an effort to make deserts more viable for colonization, scientists introduced a variety of genetically modified creatures that are made to survive the melting heat and provide food to those who wished to live in such harsh conditions. One such creature is the Cactipine. Despite its name, it is actually a giant rat infused with the DNA of a cactus. It resulted in the specimen gaining sharp medical quills, hardened green skin, and a funny tasting "meat" that confused vegetarians and carnivores alike.
LanguageData.AA_Cactipine.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_Cactipine.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYak.label: chameleon yak
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYak.description:
The Chameleon Yak is a long-haired domesticated bovid that has evolved a fascinating survival mechanism involving camouflage, similar to the way a chameleon changes its skin colour in response to different stimuli. The Chameleon Yak takes this a step further, changing its very metabolism according to the environment it is inhabiting at the time.

Chameleon Yaks will change their temperature tolerance depending on their environment, and even produce different types of wool. This change occurs at the cellular level and is very fast, but doesn't harm the animal in the slightest.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYak.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYak.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.AA_ChameleonYak.tools.2.label: right hoof
LanguageData.AA_ChemfuelMyrmidon.label: chemfuel myrmidon
LanguageData.AA_ChemfuelMyrmidon.description: This ant-like creature was created as a replacement for the ubiquitous boomalope. Chemfuel Myrmidons consume both meat and vegetables and ferment them into a powerful chemfuel mixture, which can be periodically extracted from the animal. Contrary to the Boomalope, Myrmidons are quite resistant to damage, specially damage caused by high temperatures. They are perfectly content living in red-hot semi liquid ground.\n\nUnfortunately, their irascible temperament didn't make them as popular as their more fragile predecessors.
LanguageData.AA_ChemfuelMyrmidon.tools.0.label: head claw
LanguageData.AA_ChemfuelMyrmidon.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.label: cinderlisk
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.description:
Probably the most dangerous of the Feralisk variants, the Cinderlisk is a huge spider adapted to living close to the calderas of dormant volcanoes. Originally created to be exploited for their durable and heat-resistant silk, but once they escaped into the wild they began multiplying uncontrollably.

Cinderlisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs stun and burn anyone they touch, allowing the Cinderlisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome fangs. Their fangs are also burning-hot, so they tend to light things on fire.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Cinderlisk.verbs.0.label: fire web
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetle.label: Crepuscular Beetle
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetle.description: A very large arthropod reminiscent of an oversized Hercules Beetle, the Crepuscular Beetle is a peaceful herbivore that originated from a mysterious Rimworld orbiting a very faint star, perpetually covered in darkness. This was the home planet of an elusive race known as the Forsakens, and Crepuscular Beetles were often used as domesticated beasts of burden.\n\nCrepuscular Beetles are active during dusk. They also don't need a lot of rest, expending much less time than other creatures to replenish their energies.
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetle.tools.0.label: head claw
LanguageData.AA_CrepuscularBeetle.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_CrescendoAnole.label: crescendo anole
LanguageData.AA_CrescendoAnole.description:
Most of the time, the Crescendo Anole is a harmless iguanian lizard that feeds on vegetation and small arthropods. They are unusually intelligent, and can be kept as pets. However, when the anole becomes aggressive in any way, usually in self defense, an unstable cocktail of growth hormones and biomechanical mechanites causes a runaway growth of the creature's cells, turning it into a hulking crocodilian nightmare.

This effect is temporary, lasting a few hours, and afterwards the anole must recover its strength to be able to go through it again, becoming extremely hungry in the interim.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_CrescendoAnole.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_CrescendoAnole.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_CrescendoAnole.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.label: crystalline caracal
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.description:
A heavily modified medium-sized wild cat, the crystalline caracal can often be seen lazying around in the sun, recharging its internal energies. It can later use this stored energy to release a powerful blast of concentrated light. Typically nocturnal, the crystalline caracal is highly secretive and difficult to observe. It is territorial, and lives mainly alone or in pairs.

Contrary to other purely photosynthetic creatures, the caracal can also hunt small prey, and it needs both kinds of sustenance to survive.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_CrystallineCaracal.verbs.0.label: laser
LanguageData.AA_CrystalMit.label: crystalmit
LanguageData.AA_CrystalMit.description:
A Crystalmit is a Pebblemit that has been genetically modified to feed on minerals. Crystalmits have a partly silicon-based biology, so they can derive substenance from eating scattered rocks.

Crystalmits were created as a quick way of removing rock rubble from mining operations, but wild ones may prove to be a nuisance for colonies who'd rather use rocks for something useful.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_CrystalMit.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Darkbeast.label: darkbeast
LanguageData.AA_Darkbeast.description:
The darkbeast is a mechanoid-infused variant of the thunderbeast, in which the bioelectric organs have been removed and replaced with metallic spikes housing a distributed cloud of sun-blocking mechanites.

These deployable mechanite clouds can cover a huge region, blanketing it in darkness, and it is thought that the darkbeast was created as a terrorist weapon that attacks settlements by depriving them of sunlight, affecting their agricultural yields. Darkbeasts have naturally evolved over the centuries making them extremely unstable, and they will only release enough mechanites upon death. Thankfully, predators usually give them a wide berth.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Darkbeast.tools.0.label: horn
LanguageData.AA_Darkbeast.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Darkbeast.verbs.0.label: dark bolt
LanguageData.AA_DarkVandal.label: dark vandal
LanguageData.AA_DarkVandal.description: A creature of pure muscle, the Dark Vandal is known for its incredible strength. Often seen foraging in groups among the undergrowth, they have gathered renown for their fiercely protective behavior over other members of their brood. Once provoked, the resulting rampage is the last thing many colonies see before their destruction under the might of an enraged pack. Despite its infamous reputation, the beast is still hunted across the Rim, not only for their thick hide or ample supply of meat, but also by warrior societies as a rite of passage.\n\nSpecial abilities: Dark Vandals will dig searching for truffles if they are hungry. Bear in mind that they can only do so when on top of a diggable terrain.
LanguageData.AA_DarkVandal.tools.0.label: tusk
LanguageData.AA_DarkVandal.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.label: decay drake
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.description:
Decay Drakes are large, winged flightless lizards that inhabit places with an abundance of vegetation. Even though the drakes are carnivorous, they release a nauseous cocktail of volatile pheromones that quickly accelerates the rotting process of plants, turning vegetation around them into mounds of fermented organic matter. They will consume these over hunting for fresh meat, and usually get incredibly drunk in the process. Interestingly, the creature has four separate livers in order to process the huge amounts of alcohol.

They aren't easy to domesticate, but if they can be coerced to accept humans, they might be useful hunting companions, specially if provided with alcohol...

Human beings have been known to consume the rotting vegetation in desperate times, but most people would rather starve.
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.tools.2.label: razorfangs
LanguageData.AA_DecayDrake.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DesertAve.label: desert ave
LanguageData.AA_DesertAve.description:
The Desert Ave is a large flightless bird adapted to living in very arid terrains. Large bony plates cover its neck, giving it a much-needed defense both from predators and from the scalding heat of the desert sun. Compared to their more common Meadow Ave relatives, Desert Aves are less temperamental, but their slightly smaller size makes them less useful as pack animals.

Desert Aves are amazing mounts, much faster than horses, and if properly trained they can be ridden into battle at incredible speeds (this interaction needs the Giddy-Up, combat mounts mod, and it will make the Desert Aves move 50% faster when used as mounts).

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_DesertAve.tools.0.label: claws
LanguageData.AA_DesertAve.tools.2.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DevilSheep.label: devil sheep
LanguageData.AA_DevilSheep.description: A genetically engineered sheep capable of producing extremely strong and valuable red wool. Some see a simple livestock; others, a demonic entity of corruption. Don’t listen to its whispers. Like devilstrand mushrooms, these sheep take some time to grow the fabric, but they can be easily bred to increase production as needed.\n\nArt by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_DevilSheep.tools.0.label: left hoof
LanguageData.AA_DevilSheep.tools.1.label: right hoof
LanguageData.AA_DevilSheep.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DrainerLarva.label: drainer larva
LanguageData.AA_DrainerLarva.description:
A mostly harmless, cat-sized lepidopteran with brightly coloured wings. Drainers were originally blue morpho butterflies that mutated due to exposure to high levels of radiation in some wretched planet of the Rim. Though they can feed on grass if there is no other food available, they are actually electrovores, feeding on any available source of electricity. Unfortunately for colonies on the Rim, this means batteries...

Drainers undergo metamorphosis like most other lepidopterans, though their larval stage is pretty short, and doesn't have the energy draining abilities of the adults.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_DrainerLarva.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Drainer.label: drainer
LanguageData.AA_Drainer.description:
A mostly harmless, cat-sized lepidopteran with brightly coloured wings. Drainers were originally blue morpho butterflies that mutated due to exposure to high levels of radiation in some wretched planet of the Rim. Though they can feed on grass if there is no other food available, they are actually electrovores, feeding on any available source of electricity. Unfortunately for colonies on the Rim, this means batteries...

Drainers undergo metamorphosis like most other lepidopterans, though their larval stage is pretty short, and doesn't have the energy draining abilities of the adults.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.label: dunealisk
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.description: Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for synthread-web production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire. The Dunealisk is a mutant variation of the Feralisk that has adapted to extremely hot climates.\n\nDunealisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs stun and burn anyone they touch, allowing the Dunealisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Dunealisk.verbs.0.label: fire web
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskClutchMother.label: dunealisk clutch mother
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskClutchMother.description:
Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for synthread-web production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire. The Dunealisk is a mutant variation of the Feralisk that has adapted to extremely hot climates.

Dunealisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs stun and burn anyone they touch, allowing the Dunealisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

This Dunealisk seems to be of much larger size than usual, and is carrying a clutch of eggs on its back. This sounds like a recipe for disaster if not dealt with quickly.
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskClutchMother.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskClutchMother.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_DunealiskClutchMother.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.label: dusk prowler
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.description: A result of failed animal weaponization trials, the dusk prowler is an ideal killing machine, built and modified to satisfy the requirements of fast-paced warfare. The fierce nature of the prowler is reinforced further by the muscular protrusions on their back, which simultaneously act as both accelerators and as weapons. Their capability to overrun even the most well defended military facilities resulted in the systematic purge that was commissioned by the intergalactic federations centuries ago, in hopes of driving the prowlers to extinction. Thus, very few prowler sightings are reported across the Rim nowadays, with those who see one almost never making it out alive to tell the tale.
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.tools.0.label: ninetails
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.tools.1.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.tools.2.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_DuskProwler.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.AA_DuskRat.label: dusk rat
LanguageData.AA_DuskRat.description: A widely-hated rodent known for soiling kitchens and spreading disease, rats have a way of following humans everywhere they go. It eats almost anything and lives almost anywhere.\n\nThis rat seems to be markedly different from other rats. It is a purely nocturnal animal, and it has four glowing eyes.
LanguageData.AA_DuskRat.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_DuskRat.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_DuskRat.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterflyLarva.label: Empress butterfly larva
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterflyLarva.description: The Empress Butterfly originates from an extremely rare type of planet – a Paradise Glitterworld. These planets have reached an extreme level of technology, but their inhabitants are very psychically sensitive, using their technology to offset any impact they might have on the planet's ecosystem and thereby anima. The Empress Butterfly was engineered as the perfect pollinator, gathering pollen from genetically engineered plants that increase the fertility of the surrounding terrain and releasing it nearby.\n\nLarvae of the species are small, slow and practically useless, but they have no special dietary constraints.
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterflyLarva.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterfly.label: Empress butterfly
LanguageData.AA_EmpressButterfly.description: The Empress Butterfly originates from an extremely rare type of planet – a Paradise Glitterworld. These planets have reached an extreme level of technology, but their inhabitants are very psychically sensitive, using their technology to offset any impact they might have on the planet's ecosystem and thereby anima. The Empress Butterfly was engineered as the perfect pollinator, gathering pollen from genetically engineered plants that increase the fertility of the surrounding terrain and releasing it nearby.\n\nAdult Empress Butterflies have strict dietary constraints, as they demand a very specific type of food: flowers from the plant known as pollen trumpet, a long-lived decorative plant that was created to be in symbiosis with the butterfly. If they can't find pollen trumpets nearby, they will grudgingly resort to eating other farm plants nearby, thereby negating their usefulness to the colony. A good supply of mature pollen trumpets will be needed unless you want the butterfly to absolutely annihilate your crops.
LanguageData.AA_EngorgedTentacularAberration.label: engorged tentacular aberration
LanguageData.AA_EngorgedTentacularAberration.descript: A grotesque mass of writhing tentacles, mouths and eyes, quivering in violent spasms as it strives to breathe. This poor creature knows only pain and suffering, and will be glad to inflict it upon others. Created by infusing an animal with the strange energies from an extradimensional corruption.
LanguageData.AA_Erin.label: erin
LanguageData.AA_Erin.description: The Erin (Hyaena Erinae), also commonly known as a Corpsemouth, is a disgusting genetically modified hyena with reptilian characteristics. Erins were created as a perfect scavenger, greatly preferring to feed on already dead animals than hunting them, although if no corpses are present they will resort to hunting their own prey or consuming butchered meat.\n\n.Erins will receive a considerable health boost if consuming fresh corpses that they didn't have to kill, making them both great at corpse disposal and as front line attackers if they are properly fed. Furthermore, they have the ability to regurgitate stomach acids as a dangerous ranged attack.
LanguageData.AA_Erin.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_Erin.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_Erin.tools.2.label: fangs
LanguageData.AA_Erin.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Erin.verbs.0.label: acidic vomit
LanguageData.AA_Eyeling.label: eyeling
LanguageData.AA_Eyeling.description: A grotesquely enlarged eye, crawling around with the help of a few fleshy tentacles. Not very useful at all. Created by infusing an animal with the strange energies from an extradimensional corruption.
LanguageData.AA_Eyeling.tools.0.label: eye
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.label: feralisk
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.description:
Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for synthread-web production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire.

Feralisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs stun anyone they touch, allowing the Feralisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_Feralisk.verbs.0.label: web
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskClutchMother.label: feralisk clutch mother
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskClutchMother.description:
Someone once thought that creating supersized spiders for synthread-web production was a good idea. Their home planet is now reduced to a Marble World; a world completely purged by atomic fire.

Feralisks attack by throwing spider webs at their prey. These huge webs stun anyone they touch, allowing the Feralisk to close in and finish the kill with their fearsome venom laced fangs.

This Feralisk seems to be of much larger size than usual, and is carrying a clutch of eggs on its back. This sounds like a recipe for disaster if not dealt with quickly.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskClutchMother.tools.0.label: left first leg
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskClutchMother.tools.1.label: right first leg
LanguageData.AA_FeraliskClutchMother.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_FireWasp.label: fire wasp
LanguageData.AA_FireWasp.description: Fire wasps are predatory creatures that feed on burning flesh and vegetation. The wasps themselves are not particularly dangerous for humans, though they may prey on small animals and pets. The danger comes from their eggs, whether fertilized or not: they constantly produce an intense heat, that might even cause fires in the vicinity. A single fire wasp egg unthinkingly placed in a refrigerator will be enough to spoil all the food inside.
LanguageData.AA_FireWasp.tools.1.label: claws
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouse.label: fission mouse
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouse.description:
Even though this creature is usually called a mouse, it has more traits in common with the banner-tailed kangaroo rat, such as a jumping bipedal locomotion.

The fission mouse is yet another example of human genetic engineering gone terribly wrong. Presumably, the objective was to make the mice more useful as laboratory animals by increasing their resistance and longevity. The unexpected result is a sterile creature with neither attribute, but a really strange side effect: when the animal dies, three duplicates are created, sharing all memories of its parent.

Rapid successive fission events are also harmful to the creature itself. If less than a few years pass between events, the mouse eventually perishes, unable to sustain its life cycle.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouse.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouse.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouse.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseSecond.label: fission mouse, second generation
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseSecond.description:
Even though this creature is usually called a mouse, it has more traits in common with the banner-tailed kangaroo rat, such as a jumping bipedal locomotion.

The fission mouse is yet another example of human genetic engineering gone terribly wrong. Presumably, the objective was to make the mice more useful as laboratory animals by increasing their resistance and longevity. The unexpected result is a sterile creature with neither attribute, but a really unexpected side effect: when the animal dies, three duplicates are created, sharing all memories of its parent.

Rapid successive fission events are also harmful to the creature itself. If less than a few years pass between events, the mouse eventually perishes, unable to sustain its life cycle.

This fission mouse is of second generation, indicating the fission process has happened once recently, making it weaker.

Art by Feroxiious (check her Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/feroxiious/).
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseSecond.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseSecond.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseSecond.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseThird.label: fission mouse, third generation
LanguageData.AA_FissionMouseThird.description:
Even though this creature is usually called a mouse, it has more traits in common with the banner-tailed kangaroo rat, such as a jumping bipedal locomotion.

The fission mouse is yet another example of human genetic engineering gone terribly wrong.
